moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d5 3. exd5 Qxd5 4. Qe2 N: pawn attacked twice and defended once.
Trying to even up material but setting myself up for a narrowly averted disaster.
moves.17. c3 Qa4: There are worse moves I could have made here, but not many.
moves.18. Nc5: Nc4? My opponent somehow missed the game winning NxN+ leaving my queen en prise.
moves.18... Qb5 19. Qd6 Rae8 20. Re2: He obviously intended to stack rooks, but missed my queen on the diagonal. In addition, attempting to stack them on the file I controlled was less than ideal.
moves.20... Qxe2: and now he's five points down.
moves.21. Bf1 Qxb2 22. Nb3: Trying to save the rook and the pawn, but lost a pawn and a knight after...
moves.23... Re7xe1 24. axb3 Qxb3 25. Qd4 Qb5: With the bishop pinned, I'm trying for QxB mate.
moves.26. c4 Qh5: He honestly should have given up before now, but he was clearly hoping for an exceptional blunder. His best defense here is Qh4 followed by Qh3, postponing mate for several moves.
moves.27. Qxa7: Pawn hunting down eleven points and his king under siege?
moves.27... Qh3: And he resigns as there is no way to prevent Q or R xB++
